posts.post_content: How about all those 0 cost Traps? You could find one and cast it immediately. Seems like a nice sideboard idea.
posts.html:
How about all those 0 cost Traps? You could find one and cast it immediately. Seems like a nice sideboard idea.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: True_Mumin (9/26/2009 1:15:50 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
There are so many diverse traps. This really allows for toolbox style trap decks.   
  
And while it ruins the surprise, your opponent still doesn't know about the traps you're already holding. Or, once you've hard-cast the tutored trap as a spell, that you have a duplicate waiting in your hand. It's time for a game of Magic: the Bluffing. Too much fun.
posts.html:
There are so many diverse traps. This really allows for toolbox style trap decks.

And while it ruins the surprise, your opponent still doesn't know about the traps you're already holding. Or, once you've hard-cast the tutored trap as a spell, that you have a duplicate waiting in your hand. It's time for a game of Magic: the Bluffing. Too much fun.

posts.post_content: It isnt fun after u reveal your trap card to your opponent. =\

Posted By: JosirisDavid (9/26/2009 4:32:47 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Although tutoring trap cards is a bit messy since it prepares your opponent, this is still a cheap card which is worth using.  
On top of that you don't always have to wait for your opponent since you can have ways to pay the alternate trap cost no matter whether you opponent wants to do so or not.  
I like the card, definitely worth using in constructed. Reminds me of [Merchant Scroll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Merchant Scroll).
posts.html:
Although tutoring trap cards is a bit messy since it prepares your opponent, this is still a cheap card which is worth using.
On top of that you don't always have to wait for your opponent since you can have ways to pay the alternate trap cost no matter whether you opponent wants to do so or not.
I like the card, definitely worth using in constructed. Reminds me of Merchant Scroll.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Mode (9/26/2009 9:12:39 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This is by far one of the best cards this game has ever seen, remember, your traps alternative cost can be used as long as the opponent did the required event even if the trap wasn't in your hand, that means you can use this card right after your opponent did something you have a trap for (its an instant!) and search your deck for the correct trap, and bam, trap goes into effect. It makes all that waiting hopefully for your opponent to do the right thing very smooth, and actually allows you to play a trap deck instead of having a hand full of traps you can't necessarily use.
posts.html:
This is by far one of the best cards this game has ever seen, remember, your traps alternative cost can be used as long as the opponent did the required event even if the trap wasn't in your hand, that means you can use this card right after your opponent did something you have a trap for (its an instant!) and search your deck for the correct trap, and bam, trap goes into effect. It makes all that waiting hopefully for your opponent to do the right thing very smooth, and actually allows you to play a trap deck instead of having a hand full of traps you can't necessarily use.

posts.post_content: The fact that Trapmaker's Snare is an Instant *and* puts the tutored Trap into your hand makes this quite good. Don't forget that you can cast the tutored Trap before letting anything resolve on the stack.
